bugs.title: CVE-2018-6198 w3m: insecure temporary files creation when ~/.w3m is unwritable

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-6198 w3m: insecure temporary files creation when ~/.w3m is unwritable

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in w3m 0.5.3-34. When ~/.w3m is unwritable, w3m uses /tmp in an insecure fashion, which allows a local attacker to craft a symlink attack to overwrite arbitrary files.

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/tats/w3m/commit/18dcbadf2771cdb0c18509b14e4e73505b242753

Created w3m tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1539130]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1539129]
Fixed for all the requested releases.

you may clone this bug as appropriate.

bugs.title: CVE-2018-6197 w3m: Null pointer dereference in formUpdateBuffer in form.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-6197 w3m: Null pointer dereference in formUpdateBuffer in form.c

long_desc.thetext:
w3m through 0.5.3 is prone to a NULL pointer dereference flaw in formUpdateBuffer in form.c.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/tats/w3m/issues/89

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/tats/w3m/commit/7fdc83b0364005a0b5ed869230dd81752ba022e8

Created w3m tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1539153]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1539154]
Fixed for all the requested releases.

bugs.title: CVE-2018-6196 w3m: Infinite recursion in HTMLlineproc0

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-6196 w3m: Infinite recursion in HTMLlineproc0

long_desc.thetext:
w3m through 0.5.3 is prone to an infinite recursion flaw in HTMLlineproc0 because the feed_table_block_tag function in table.c does not prevent a negative indent value.

Upstream bug:

https://github.com/tats/w3m/issues/88

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/tats/w3m/commit/8354763b90490d4105695df52674d0fcef823e92

Created w3m tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1539160]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1539159]
Fixed for all the requested releases.
